I think for gameplay its important to ramp up difficulty so ~the last 1/3 takes about as long as the first 2/3. Its important to get the player committed before making them suffer otherwise you wont be spent cost fallacied to grinding past your skill level.

Fangames train your resilience
I do also disagree with the fan games staying the same difficulty, thats just basic game desighn, make the difficulty progress, however this is too much
The key to difficulty is to backload it
That way people are invested and want to finish it so they don't notice how much it sucks
This is the problem with strategy games. The difficulty is always frontloaded
So getting through the early game is a pain, but once you get through it you've already won even though you still have half the game to go
I disagree, it doesn't feel as satisfying when the second half is free
You want difficult jumps at the end
